head.supplied: ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of 30th ultimo asking that a belt of trees may be planted round the site for the new Observatory as a protection against dust. Dr Mueller,...

div.p: Unit 3, VPRS 780 inward correspondence, Melbourne Observatory, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 25.10.93. To proof.
follow up in Chief Sec.
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of 30th ultimo asking that a belt of trees may be planted round the site for the new Observatory as a protection against dust. Dr Mueller, to whom you letter has been submitted, reports that he will endeavor to carry out the wishes of the Board of Visitors as soon as the ground is prepared for the reception of the trees and shrubs by fencing and trenching. I understand him to say that the Board of Land and Works has consented to have these preliminary works done under its orders.
